Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and well placed”
Reviews.Author: Patchfi
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for four nights in November. Both the bathroom and bedroom were good sizes by Paris standards. The decor was excellent, warm and welcoming. The hotel is well positioned for access to the Opera area. There are many restaurants within a two or three block radius. This is a two star hotel so there are limited amenities in the rooms; no fridge, only one english langauage channel on the tv (repeating the same programming every day). This was not an issue for us as we were there only to rest and sleep. The man in the little bar next door sold us water each evening and we returned the glass bottles the next morning. It worked for us. A couple of minor issues I noted. The bathroom tiles in the shower area are getting decidely tatty and need the grout cleaning or replacing to remove mould. At night we had to keep the bathroom door closed as we could clearly hear people arguing in another room through the air/steam vent. Most staff were excellent although one had little knowledge of tourist info. Very, very friendly and welcoming all the same.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nora M
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in Paris, centrally located walking distance from the Opera (and the big department stores). Super friendly staff, the room was larger than what we have experienced for similar priced hotels in Paris, good organic breakfast buffet (inexpensive for Paris at 9 euros). The weather was nice so we were lucky to be able to use the rooftop terrace to open a bottle of wine before dinner. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent with flaws”
Reviews.Author: andrecav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed clean and somewhat cosy, at present with free wi-fi. The location is not so good. My room was ok, but had a incredibly small bathroom and a horrible window view. Yet the worst part is the noise: you inevitably hear all the time people going up and down the wooden stairs and sometimes even in their rooms. Friendly staff. I would not say it is a good value hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, large triple room”
Reviews.Author: imi138
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room in Hotel Mogador based on the tripadvisor reviews, and was very pleased to see that it was a very good size. Small rooms are the norm in Europe (and especially in Paris), so we were very grateful to have the extra space and not have to feel cramped. The room was clean, and the hotel was in a good location (20 mins walk to the Louvre).

Reviews.Title: “Small, but cute & clean”
Reviews.Author: Lauren9artist
Reviews.Content: Visited for 5 nights with a friend following a study abroad program. The staff was incredibly helpful, especially since neither of us spoke French - helped with maps/directions and arranging an early a.m. cab back to the airport on our last day. The hotel is small, but cute - our room included a nice double pane window that opened to the street below with plenty of plugs for laptop charging, and a nice vanity outside of the bathroom. Spacious closet with a safe and a flat screen tv. The only downside is location - the Mogador is cheaper from most Parisian hotels because it's relatively isolated from any major spots and easy to get lost near. We always had a map and still had difficulties finding our way back on several occasions. It's a good 15 minute walk to the Opera House which is the nearest major site with tour bus pick up/easy access to other sites. Perks: Free Wifi, excellent front desk service Things to be aware of: NO elevator lift. We were on the third floor and had some assistance with the late night manager helping carry our luggage up some very narrow stairs, but had to carry them down alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: tapiocapudding
Reviews.Content: This place had a lovely clean, fresh feel to it. Wood and tiled floors throughout, with a lovely wee terrace up on the roof. I was really pleased with the standard of decor throughout the hotel, esecially in my room and en-suite. The staff are extremely pleasant and very helpful. Free internet access. Good central location, but off a side street, so not too noisy. Good central location....close to metro stations and bus stops, and a couple of bike stations within a few 100 yards. What you see on their website, is what you get. Lovely place....I wouldn't hesitate to book in here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: lottagus
Reviews.Content: Situated right between the City Center and Montmartre, in the Opera District (9th arrondissement). Excellent location if you want to explore more of Paris than just the City Center. The room was quite small, but good enough. Our room had a bathtub. The bed was perfectly OK. Unfortunately the doors were paper thin, and you could hear every word your neighbours said in the hallway. During the weekend when we stayed at Hotel Mogador the staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Allright”
Reviews.Author: LakshmiCologne
Reviews.Content: The Mogador is located 5 minutes by foot from metro and bus station (bus takes you to Gare du Nord in ten minutes) in a quite neighborhood which ensures a good sleep. Some restaurants and boulangeries are to be found in the vicinity of the metro station. The lobby is nicely styled and welcoming. The rooms are what you expect from Paris: some 10 contorted square meters (estimated), including bathroom. While the bathroom was quite modernly styled and in perfect condition (positive surprise), the rest of the room was in some kind of mediterranean style but also very clean. This is with the exception of the bed sheets, which had some ugly stains. The matresses were not comfortabel, you could feel the springs. There is heating in the room and a controller for the - non-existent - AC. In July, it gets rather hot and humid in the room if you do not open the window. Ours looked into a very ugly small court. The reception guys are friendly but not overly eager to help. Nobody offered to bring the luggage to the third floor (no lift!), our promised wake up call never happened (thank God for smartphones) and to get a taxi in the morning proved to be impossible for the concierge. Considering it is Paris, the value for money (we paid 89€ plus tax per night), might still be acceptable. But either for a business trip or a romantic getaway, there are better choices (though much worse ones, too). Having spent nights in probably more than 20 Parisian hotels, it must however be said that good ones with value for money are rare to find.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: juliahoy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris so I have no frame of reference as far as cost or accommodations, but considering a coke is about 4 euro in most cafes, Hotel Mogador is a steal! The room was very large with a gorgeous bathroom. Seriously, the bathroom was huge even for an American hotel. Very tastefully decorated as well. My only peeves with the hotel was the uncomfortable bed and the internet. Your stay at the hotel comes with internet except 2 rooms don't receive the signal, unfortunately we stayed in one of those 2 rooms. The bed was very, very, very firm. As far the location it's ok, it's not close to all the action. Although with the abundance of metro stations in Paris you're not far from anything. Basically, it's a good hotel, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newdale
Reviews.Content: The Mogador, a little way out but if you dont mind a walk or using the metro an ideal place to say. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean and well kept. The room we had was lovely and the layout a little quirky which we loved. We had to ask for additional towels which they duely provided and the hot water was a little temperamental. But overall great value for money and comparable to some 4 star hotels in which I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: chana2
Reviews.Content: NB: We stayed in May 2010 (but 'Date of stay' didn't have that option). We chose this place solely for central location and value, but we also got great service to boot, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Wifey was pregnant so the stairs were a bit tiring for her, but the room and bathroom were fine for the price, especially since we were using the room more as a sleeping base than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great Location, Great for 2-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michellez_11
Reviews.Content: Front staff desk was very helpful. For a 2-star hotel, if you are looking for a great value in Paris with a great location, this is the place to stay. No AC or elevator and not the most comfortable bed in the world (but what are you expecting from a 2-star hotel). Room was as large or larger than the 4-star hotel I stayed in for work, nice, clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: 3london
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located about 5 Minutes away from Opera Garnier and Boulevard Haussmann whith Paris' most famous shops Galeries Lafayette and Printemps. Montmartre is just a 10 minutes walk away. Itâ€™s also close to metro lines 7 and 12. These lines are perfect not only if you arrive at and depart from Gare de lâ€™est, but also if you want to go to Louvre, Champs Elysees, Notre Dame... The rooms are small (some of them smaller than others) but not too small and even though the hotel is located at a quiet street we were happy to have rooms to the backyard. These rooms probably also get less hot in the summer time (no regular airconditioning, but in the closets there were either ventilators or air conditionings for hotter days, also no mini bar/fridge in the rooms). The only noise comes from inside the hotel. Walls are really thin. Accordingly I recommend earplugs for those with a light sleep. The rooms are quite clean (even though they should dust the cushions on the wall above the bed as well as the old mirrors). When I read the feedback at tripadvisor that one of the guests felt attacked by a toilet role holder, I was wondering how this could be a problem for anyone. Now I know because I obviously got the same room as this person. This roll holder has to be taken off. It is dangerous. As already said by others on tripadvisor: there is no elevator in the hotel, but itâ€™s a small hotel with only about three floors and the receptionists offer to help you with luggage. I didnâ€™t try the wireless internet in the rooms, instead I used the computer in the lobby to check emails etc. The breakfast was quite good for Paris standard: great baguette, croissant (with chocolate) and bread, cereals, jam, yoghurt, cheese. Most of the people working at the reception were really friendly and helpful. We had a great stay, loved the location, and definitely recommend this hotel and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “I'm definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: nellynell8
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel!Really close to the metro station and various shops,restaurants and bistros.Staff were amazingly polite and helpful!No stairs but we knew that already.Breakfast is pricey for what it offers (just some croissants and baguettes) but there are plenty of places for breakfast around.We stayed in a room for four.It was cosy and lovely,really felt we were in Paris.Quiet street but safe.The wc was in a different space from the bath which was convenient in the morning when there are 4 people who want to get ready.It was very clean as well.I absolutely loved that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Kiwikid0
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night as it is very close to the CDG airport bus stop, easy walk. My room was a nice size but the bathroom was something else, tiny and the toilet almost impossible to back into. Yes, back into. As well there was a toilet roll holder hanging loose at the side of the loo and the thing almost attacked me and was highly dangerous, it could cause a nasty injury, who in their right mind chose to put it there is crazy. The breakfast was only okay and I only had it there for quickness as I left early to the airport. As is usual in Paris, the breakfast was overpriced. The owners are nice and helpful so cannot fault that side of the stay. If you need to be near the Opera Garnier or Galeries Lafayette area, the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nimrodnm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights ov er New Year. Hotel in a fantastic location, close to a few metro stops for various lines, and near the stop at Opera for the Roissy Bus from CDG airport and the open top tour bus which is a great way to get around and see Paris. The hotel can be a bit noisy, however if you shut the door outside your room door this quietens things down quite a lot. All in all the hotel is really affordable in comparison to others, has very nice traditional rooms, it's in a great location and will provide a great base for a nice time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, free internet and close to Galleries Lafayette.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa8383
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, very clean and close to the underground train station. The breakfast was nice and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only problem with this hotel is the fact that it doesn't have a lift, which makes it difficult if you have heavy luggage. However, the fact that it is pretty affordable and in a great location makes you forget the fact that you have to climb a few stairs.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at hotel mogador”
Reviews.Author: losita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Mogador for 2 nights October 19th and 20th, 2010. We had a quiet room and a good sleep. I couldn't get the tub to work, so had to shower, also the hotel seemed to run out of hot water in the morning. Nonethless, the location is ideal and the reception staff were marvelous, helping us try to get a taxi one morning during the strike.

Reviews.Title: “What a find! This place is dverythingbyou need and more”
Reviews.Author: ReneeAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Mogador for 4 nights and can't fault our stay. Although reception staff changed regularly everyone was very helpful and attentive. The rooms were spotlessly clean and a great size- I believe a rare find in the heart in Paris. Location was great- safe area within a short walk to many restaurant options and a couple of metro lines and close enough (for us anyway) to walk all over Paris from! This Hotel is a great find in the centre of paris where prices and value for money can vary greatly!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cosy hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: Martuszka
Reviews.Content: Mogador is a hidden jewel offering excellent value for the money. It's decorated with taste in a slightly rustical style. The personnel was very nice and genuinely interested in our satisfaction. The only disadvantage is that the hotel is located in a renovated walk-up building, so be prepared to drag your suitcase up the stairs. Also, luckily the summer was still in Paris, as the window in our room didn't close and could not be fixed by the hotel staff. It would be a serious problem in winter. The hotel has a nice terrace with tables and chairs, which offers an excellent opportunity to admire Parisian stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by excellent value hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AngDav99
Reviews.Content: I am always very nervous when arriving at hotels in Paris within this price bracket as I have had some bad experiences but this hotel is wonderful! The rooms are spacious and very clean, the bathrooms well appointed and the location great. The building is quite old (as is the norm with Paris) so it was a little noisy in the morning when everyone is heading out for the day but other than that - perfect! I can't wait to stay here again and would highly recommend it! I kept waiting for the catch because it was so good! It is also within easy walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: danovich
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location within walking distance from the main train station and close to many metro stations too. The rooms and bathrooms were very nice, however the walls are quite thin and we could hear the baby crying in the next room all night. The staff are really friendly and helpful and speak English very well. I would skip the breakfast, it is relatively expensive and you don't get much at all - head to a local cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryPatch
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with good location for shopping, sightseeing and dining. Room was on the 4th floor with no lift. We didn't mind but others might. Bath extremely small but newish. No mini-fridge makes keeping a cold beer around rather difficult. Bed was short and hard as a rock. Helpful staff. For the price it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - a good find”
Reviews.Author: samuraijen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. After getting up really early to fly to Beauvais, and then enduring an hour and a half bus journey, we were just focussed on getting to the hotel, and didn't even realise that we were going a couple of hours too early to check in. When we got there this wasn't a problem though and the very friendly and helpful guy on the desk checked our room was ready and sent us up. The room was great, a good size, immaculately clean and nicely decorated with a nice bathroom that looked quite new. The location was pretty good, although it seemed to be quite an office-y area, it was pretty short walk to Monmartre and the boulevards. It was also 5 minutes from 2 metro stations, so easy and fast to get to anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett-Leeds
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable, large rooms, in need of a little touch up. Room was pretty hot as only had a stand up air conditioner and wasn't overly powerful. Guy on reception very friendly and went out of his way to help us. Location was fine, about a 10 mins walk to the metro (Opera) near all amenities eg. large designer shopping centre, good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great value find.”
Reviews.Author: RoRoLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent find. Very clean and spacious room + bathroom. Friendly staff. Definitely going to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie016
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Mogador in May by myself and loved it. I had a beautiful room, newly renovated, beautiful bathroom. The breakfast was awesome and staff very nice. I was by myself but it could have fit two. Very impress with this find. Will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “A fab find”
Reviews.Author: JHinLondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Paris a number of times and, compared with others, this hotel offers larger rooms and ensuites than most. It has lovely staff, is in a quiet neighbourhood and has reasonably good sound insulation. Comfy beds. It seems to have been recently renovated too. It's a real gem! As soon as I got back from my trip, I tried to book it again for a trip in July and am disappointed it's not available.

Reviews.Title: “Something of a find”
Reviews.Author: MrKnolly
Reviews.Content: This is a super litle hotel, very conveniently located close to Galeries Lafayette and the Palais Garnier. My room was reasonably sized for a 2 star hotel in central Paris, quiet, spotlessly clean and equipped with a powerful shower. I found the staff exceptionally friendly. The one obvious drawback is that there is no lift. No matter, I've tried at least a dozen budget-ish hotels in central Paris over the last 18 months and for me the Mogador represents something of a find. I shall probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Paris explorer!”
Reviews.Author: Rauties
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor.com and decided to book it based on the reviews of my fellow travellers who have stayed there. I can so agree with the statement that it is basically a 3-Star hotel without a lift. The double rooms were spacious by Paris standards and they had these lovely small on suite bathrooms. It is ideally located for a serious Paris explorer. The one day you can take the underground at Auber to go to the Champs Elyees and all the museums in that area and the next day you can walk to the Moulin Rouge and Sacre Cur and experience a completely different side of Paris. I will not recommend it for people having difficulty walking as the steps are narrow and four stories can be high with heavy luggage. In conclusion, I am of the opinion that it is great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Basically a 3-star but without lift”
Reviews.Author: MarkV5
Reviews.Content: A last-minute booking for Bastille Day, meaning that our choice was quite limited. Though reluctant to stay in a 2-star hotel, we wanted to be central and didn't want to pay a fortune. We ended up being pleasantly surprised; basically this is a 3-star hotel without a lift, so expect better-than-2-star facilities but with some walking up stairs. Our room was large, clean, attractive and quiet with a good bathroom where we had a very comfortable night's stay. Good location, close by Boulevard Hausmann shops but far enough to be in quiet street. Most friendly and helpful staff on all counts. Still not that cheap, but I guess that this is Paris and it was peak time. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnnyverybravo
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and cosy hotel! Friendly staff! Breakfast is not luxurious but it's enough. Quiet street, central location though!

Reviews.Title: “friendly small hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lovely location. The staff are very friendly and the quality of service is high. The price/ quality ratio is good. They serve a delicious french breakfast. Everything you need is within walking distance: bakery, shops, restaurants and metro stops. My children and I had a lovely stay and hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “No fuzz, and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Morc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend and enjoyed it very much. We looked for a budget hotel, but most of the really cheap hotels (< 80 Euro/ room) didn't seem very "reliable" (much nicer pictures than reality, so to speak). Some hotels didn't even reply to my reservation e-mail. This hotel was just above our budget, but it was worth it. My e-mails were replyed within 24 hours (in good english). On arrial there was no long check-in procedure. The room was nice and clean. The hotel seemed recently renovated. The breakfast area was very simple though, but when in Paris, there's plenty other places to go. Staff was also very friendly with 24/7 occupation of the front-desk. Good central, but quiet location with a metrostation within a 5-10 min walk. Loved it. Will surely visit again, next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Accomodation but Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Bellawesterly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I tried to book into Saint-Louis Opera's sister accomodation, the Hotel Saint-Louis Marais where we'd had a pleasant stay several years ago, but it was full. The plus side is that Hotel Saint-Louis Opera is conveniently located near Metro stops and is within walking distance of Montmartre; also, the room was exceptionally clean and of a decent size. But we didn't like lugging our bags up three flights of narrow stairs, which proved to be the only way to get to upper floors (even if fire is unlikely, I don't like the absence of a secondary egress). Our hotel room windows opened into a light shaft shared in common with adjoining buildings, limiting our privacy and from which we could smell somebody's evening meal being cooked. Also, while we were there, the toilet off the lobby backed up and the smell of sewer gas lingered, causing us to go out for our breakfast rather than eat in at the hotel's small dining area. At 105 Euros per night during the off-season I don't think we got our money's worth and will look elsewhere when next visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, could be worse”
Reviews.Author: Seetheworld2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't bad and I am sure there are worse hotels in Paris but I felt it could have been a little bit cheaper. The goods: almost all staff were quite friendly; 5 metro stop from train station/ 20 minute walk to Louvre/ 5 minute walk to Haussmann; clean (albeit small) single room. The bads: the noise factor - my room was on the first floor and I could hear everyone go up and down the wooden stairs speaking rather loudly; room was very hot at night as the fan didn't work and I didn't want to leave window open at night when windows in the adjacent building had bars a long way up; Internet access costs 10 euro for one hour, or about twenty five euro for twenty five hours. You may be better off going into an Internet cafe unless you are planning to email a lot!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mogador
HotelInfo.Address: 51 Rue de la Victoire | 09 Arr., 75009 Paris, France
